    • Constructor Detail

      • DynamicCamera

        public DynamicCamera(Engine engine,
                     com.spartanlaboratories.measurements.Rectangle world,
                     com.spartanlaboratories.measurements.Rectangle monitor)
        Creates a new Dynamic camera. The world and monitor coverage of the camera is going to match that of the arguments.
        Parameters:
        engine - the game engine
        world - the area of the world that is going to be seen by this camera
        monitor - the area of the monitor that this camera is going to cover up

      • DynamicCamera

        public DynamicCamera(Engine engine,
                     Location screenSize)
        Creates a DynamicCamera object with default properties. The default properties are: the location of the display is the center of the monitor, the size of the display is the size of the monitor, the size of the world display has a 1:1 ratio to the size of the display, the world center is (0,0).
        Parameters:
        engine - the game engine
        screenSize - the size of the screen

    • Method Detail

      • getMonitorArea

        public com.spartanlaboratories.measurements.Rectangle getMonitorArea()
        Returns a new Rectangle that represents the area of the monitor that is currently being drawn on by this camera.
        Returns:
        a Rectangle that represents monitor area

      • setMonitorStats

        public void setMonitorStats(Location center,
                            Location size)
        Sets the center location and the size of the monitor area that is being drawn on by this camera. Warning, this will change the way that quads are drawn as their size will adjust to the monitor size. If the goal is to adjust the draw area while keeping the quads the same size then its best to either use this method in conjunction with DynamicCamera.Zoom or use the method setDrawArea(Rectangle) which will adjust the world size automatically.
        Parameters:
        center - the center of the monitor area
        size - the size of the monitor area

      • setMonitorSize

        public void setMonitorSize(Location newSize)
        Sets the monitor size to the specifed value. Like setMonitorStats(Location, Location) this will not have a relative effect on the size of the world and will therefore skew drawn elements. DynamicCamera.Zoom could be used in conjunction with this to negate that effect. or setDrawArea(Rectangle) could be used instead as it automatically scales the world to fit the screen as it did before.
        Parameters:
        newSize -

      • setDrawArea

      • equals

        public boolean equals(DynamicCamera camera)
        Returns whether or not this camera has the same values as another camera. Checks only the world and monitor values.
        Parameters:
        camera - the camera to which this camera is being compared to
        Returns:
        true if the world and monitor values are the same as those of the passed in camera
        false if the world and monitor values are not the same as those of the passed in camera
